title: What is the meaning of the text describing a sense of loss of self and a search for destruction?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author expresses a sense of disorganization and destruction, feeling like a shattered grenade. They speak of a state of mind that seeks to destroy existence and become wind. They mention a special vision of life that seeks to show the dark and silent movement behind everything. In the last 200 tokens, the author describes a sudden transformation they experienced when they felt like every object contained its own ether or shadow, lifting and creating a new plane while leaving behind the dark remains. They speak of feeling like they have been given grace, experiencing indescribably beautiful things, and comparing themselves to how Rimbaud must have felt when he died.

Effettivamente, mi sento come se una grazia mi aves se distaccato ormai dal corpo, dal pensiero, dalla malat tia dell'essere. Mi accadono cose inesplicabili e indicibilmente belle. Non ho il coraggio di toccarle, di esprimerle nemmeno a me stesso. Ora sento come deve esser morto Rimbaud!
last_phrase: In the end, the darkness turns into light and the pain transforms into joy. It is a joy that comes with a price, but it is still worth it. So let us embrace the mystical contents of life, like love, knowledge, truth, science, morality, and art, and let them lead us to the light.
